forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 47. Southeast wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 56. South southeast wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The night in Downtown San Francisco unfolds under a dark, brooding sky, with raindrops tapping a soft rhythm against the pavement. The air is thick with moisture, hinting at a storm ready to unleash its fury. As the temperature hovers in the chill of the early morning, you may wish to embrace warmth through layered clothing—a comfortable sweater or a light waterproof jacket complemented by sturdy shoes that can weather puddles and slick streets.

As dawn approaches and the rain persists, the city will be painted in shades of gray, casting a somber mood across its landmarks. Visibility is limited, with the fog weaving around the outline of familiar high-rises, softening the edges of the cityscape into a dreamlike panorama. The marine layer hugs the coastline closely, obscuring the Golden Gate Bridge, reminding us of the ocean’s ever-present embrace. A day like this calls for a steaming cup of coffee from your favorite local café, perhaps while watching the world glisten in a gentle drizzle—perfectly mundane, yet quietly profound. While outdoor escapades may not be on the agenda, the allure of a cozy corner and a good book, or perhaps a leisurely stroll through the rain-saturated streets, can produce a gentle joy amid the gloom.
